data.title: Let's play some music
data.statement:
You are part of a duo playing {{guitar}} and {{drums}}. Your song is divided into several parts, each of them played by a single instrument. Your goal is to write the noise the instrument playing the part is making.

The guitar makes alternatively {{plinx}} and {{plonx}} sounds while the drums always make the {{badum}} sound except when they play the last part of the song. For this last part, they make the  {{tss}} sound.

testCases.title: Alternating instruments with final part played by drums
Validator 1
testCases.testIn:
6
guitar
drums
guitar
guitar
drums
drums
testCases.testOut:
plinx
badum
plonx
plinx
badum
tss

data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1 :>> An integer [[N]] for the number of parts in the song.
<<[[N]] next lines :>> The name of the instrument playing the current part.
data.outputDescription: <<[[N]] lines :>> The sound made by the instrument playing the part.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are part of a duo playing guitar and drums. Your song is divided into several parts, each of them played by a single instrument. Your goal is to write the noise the instrument playing the part is making.

The guitar makes alternatively plinx and plonx sounds while the drums always make the badum sound except when they play the last part of the song. For this last part, they make the tss sound.
Input
Line 1 : An integer N for the number of parts in the song.
N next lines : The name of the instrument playing the current part.
Output
N lines : The sound made by the instrument playing the part.
Constraints
1 < N < 25
Example
Input
5
guitar
drums
guitar
guitar
drums
Output
plinx
badum
plonx
plinx
tss
